intro: Ledebouria maculata, commonly known as the spotted bulbous orchid, is a species of bulbous plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming leaves that are often marked with distinctive spots or streaks. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, typically during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires moderate to bright light conditions. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and as a houseplant.
